job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Zanesville, OH
pros: Good place to work, good benefits
cons: No complaints...good place to work

pros: Good relationship with coworkers. Staff truely cares about the patients. Family go to Genesis for healthcare. Administration wants to be the chosen healthcare for the community. Staff supports each other to a point.
cons: Daily challenge and stress everyday, all day! No chance for advancement unless you happen to be one of the "favorites" of management. Stress between shifts, because each feel that they work harder than the others. Only get three sick days per year, but we are expected to care for those that are sick. Pay could be better, raises could be better. Those staff that have written warnings do not get raises, dispite the fact that they pick up extra shifts, stay over when needed, and come in early. Some charge nurses are more concerned with what they are doing and not the rest of the staff, and show favortism to other staff members.

review_title: If you are in the middle you are ok...
pros:
-For the area pay is good as long as you are salary (buy only option in the area)
-Medical coverage is good, as long as you use Genesis docs, hospital, and pharmacy
cons:
-If you work on a unit, expect to get stepped on often
-Once you accept that all doctors are god, even when they throw a chair across a room, then you will be fine
-If you stand up to a doctor, even when they are wrong, you will be fired
-Time off is a joke, first year is less that 14 days for sick, personal, all holiday, and vacation (even less if you are not full time). If you are a part time hourly employee you will earn about one shift off per 2 months (4 pays)
-Management and team work is NOT encouraged... 
-Unless you have to work here, goto Newark (Licking memorial is wonderful) or Columbus

pros:
Great insurance benefits - handy to have your bill deducted from paycheck. 
Pay is good for this part of Ohio.
Very flexible schedules.
Love, love, love 12hr shifts.   Gives extra days off.
cons:
Self-evaluation process can actually allow you to hang yourself should you not meet goals that the company or yourself have set for the calendar year.  You may miss out on getting a raise. 
Transferring from one dept/job to another is rumored to be muddied in the way that your current manager can request HR not allow you to transfer to the new dep/job.  The employee may not be informed that their request has been blocked. 
However, should you earn a degree, transferring is no problem as you will not qualify to work in your previous position.

review_title: Our new CEO (Matt Perry) will lead us into a great future
pros: The new CEO has the vision and drive to make the hospital a leader. The location in Ohio allow us to serve many needy communites. We have some of the best Doctors in their field practicing at Genesis.
cons: The management that is left over from the last CEO need to fully embrace the new vision in order for us to grow. We need to do a better job in bringing in the fresh new ideas Mr. Perry has. The QA dept needs to do a better job of focusing on the things we do well and expand those instead of just focusing on the bad .

pros: The Hospital Culture and the cause of "IT is all about the Patient" makes the job worthwhile.  The IT department is a family and generally takes care of each other.   The pay is decent for that region.  I felt that upper management handled downturns in finances well.
cons: The normal growing pains of any IT department, moving very, very quickly with a commitment of "under cost, under budget".   I had always felt there was a disconnect at the time between the Project Teams and the Engineering and Data teams, but this may have been resolved over time as when I left the Project Management Office was still finding its place in the process.

review_title: Family away from family, Even though I do not work directly w/ patients, my compassion is shown from within the kichen.
job_title: Food Service Associate in Zanesville, OH
pros: Genesis offers alot of benefits, you earn PTO(Paid Time Off) that you can use for persnal use or have doc app.. You feel like you belong like the managements really values your abilities and accomplishments Also you can chose between 3 medical plans that best suits your needs. We live the Genesis mission and are proud to be chosen as one ogf the Top 100 hospitals. we have acheived alot.
cons: Sometimes you may not get a day off for a week or more.

review_title: They say they care about their employees, yet they don't
pros: The patients and their families
cons:
Directors and management do nothing to better things when issues are brought to their attention. Managers have 'favorites' in each department and these are the ones that get the opportunities to advance

High turnover rate

pros: Great people to work with and for. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking to work in a team environment. Benefits are also very good compared to other places I have worked.
cons: I think that sometimes some of the policies were a little to rigid and I also think that there could be better staff to patient ratios for safety and care reasons.

pros: Small hospital with many offsite locations allows for a close knit healthcare facility. Genesis uses the Epic EMR and it is amazing and easy to use.
cons: Upper Management has too much power, does not value employees opinions; Managers spend WAY too much time in useless meetings that could have been resolved with an email.

pros: I like that this hospital is becoming a Magnet hospital.
cons: The other nurses. I dread going to work. I used to love to go to work.  Now I don't even pic up shifts because they all just sit around and complain about the good nurses. While they just sit there with call lights going off. If you say something to them they rat you out to management and say you have an attitude.

pros: There are very many smart compassionate employees who really care about the patients. I work with many nice and caring people.
cons:
I would advise anyone to say away from this place! The insurance is very expensive and covers very little. Of course you must use their Hospital and doctors. The medical staff is sub par, but treated as royalty. The Hospital is old, dirty and the equipment is very outdated. They time off policy is a joke. They don't even offer bereavement, you have to use your vacation. You can't even use the time off policy because they are so understaffed.You are constantly expected to stay many hours over your shift with no extra compensation. I do have a family and struggle to find a sitter who will watch my children 16 hours a day. Can't afford an in home nanny. I don't work in management.  
There is little communication from management .Policies are interpreted at the discretion of each department manager always to their benefit. Don't ever question a doctor, even if the outcome could be bad for the patient you will be fired. Employees are to bow down to every physcian because they bring in revenue. It's all about the mighty dollar. The new CEO has cut benefits and raises so he can make a name for himself by building a new hospital. Management knows they don't have to treat you fairly because there are many nursing schools in the area, and plenty of new grads to take your job if you quit or get fired. The morale is so low and everyone is constantly complaining. With  the tight job market they have no choice. No compassion for employees or patients. Management doesn't know how to manage finances. Poorly run and always in the red. I would not go there for medical treatment of any kind even though I work there.

pros: Loved the job itself and the patients I care for. Radiologists are outstanding and great staff well. At one time the dept functioned as a family.
cons: Very poor management. No morale in dept. We have watched long term nurses and other staff in the dept leave. Long term nurses left due to unprofessional coordinator and due to bullying from him. Lack of experience in new nurses being hired. Dept is in need of equipment for patient safety and operates with a skeleton crew who lack experience putting patients at risk. 20+ years and the management team is the worst ever. Managers attempt to write up staff at the end of the year to prevent giving pay raises. Overall environment is very unprofessional with very immature employees but management worries more about obtaining magnet status and numbers. There is no respect, appreciation or gratitude for those employees who work hard and are dedicated. Many of us have devoted many years to the Dept but in the end have found new employment. Managers will sit in meetings on their cell phones yet if someone is caught with one in a non-patient area checking their phone it's a huge offense. Managers have created an environment to turn staff against one another and they no longer trust each other.  Even have lost outstanding radiologists due to poor management. Upper management, administration and CEO have no concern for complaints about managers and will not intervene. This dept is a sentinel event waiting to happen.

pros: Great talented midlevel leadership and staff.
cons: Senior Level Management lacks transparency.

pros: Great team to work with, great  management  and always willing to work with you on your schedule and they will also help you move up to another department.
cons: If you only work part time you only will have 24 hours a week. As to other positions.

pros: Friendly coworkers, amazing Radiologists, and of course, the patients.
cons: Toxic micromanagement. Employees are treated with mistrust and an attitude that they are expendable. A department with a long history of experienced teammates who have spent most, if not all of their career here, has now become a revolving door of recent graduates.

pros: Lots of great people at Genesis!
cons:
The politics are ridiculous. 
I think Matt Perry is very shielded as to what is really going on...

pros: Great management and feel they are very keen on life/work balance.  Great team atmosphere and no drama in my IT department.  Very nice work environment.
cons: having said that I would have liked to of seen a more flexible schedule opportunity
